title: If your game is being drophacked/DDOSed note down the details/record the game
body:
So I had a game yesterday where it was obviously being DDOSed by someone in the game since whenever we tried to fight them, everyone would disconnect.

Now, it was obvious who it was, so instead of complaining in all-chat I opened up some recording software and recorded the fights where it happened with every bit of evidence I could find. I then uploaded the clips to YouTube and sent it off to Riot Support who are going to deal with it. 

There is no point complaining about it on the boards or in all-chat, that won't have an effect. Riot aren't going to do anything about it. You need to detail what happened and send it to Riot support.

replies.body: I'm saying i'll ddos you as a joke because ya'll think i ddos. What a fu*cking joke.
You shouldn't joke about it though. Given there's 'proof' Riot has every right to act on it, whether you were joking or not.
They kept saying i ddos, so i said it as a joke, but i know now...

Do you have a link for the video? I'm curious. I didn't realise people openly ddos'd, i thought it was more of a small group that target servers instead of individual games. But I'm uneducated in that area...

The servers have been %%%%ty lately though, Everyone dc'ing within the first 10 minutes. Such a pain :(

gib us the logs


 i want to laugh at his stupidity

I had a chuckle

Gut him

On a game of ARAM 30 minutes ago, we had an incident where whenever my team engaged combat with the enemy team a majority of us would disconnect and reconnect within 20 seconds... however it was only us that disconnected so the enemy team just steamrolled us.

I looked at everyone's match history, and none of them had consecutive wins to indicate someone on the team was DDOS'ing us, HOWEVER it did say in the chat box "Call Me Noob has unpaused the game!". this was probably just the server trying to react to the possible attack but i would like this to not be forgotten, as if people are openly DDOS'ing UNRANKED ARAM games then what hope is there for ranked?

KEEP THE POST GOING

Does recording software consumes a lot of performance while filming? Since I can only run LoL on low settings, getting uncapped max fps of 58 or so.

You recon when recording softs are on, I can still at least muscle 55 fps (or somewhere around that)? If so which one would you suggest?

But yes, recording and send off to Riot is a calm and a smart move. I tend to agree.
